column4: anyone that can help me with the ssh config file? i get the message /etc/ssh/ssh_config: line 55: Bad configuration option: Hostkey
what are you trying to do?
ssh into a server i have
!tab | exogrim
ok...what are you trying to achieve by adding Hostkey to the config file?
sry
just makes it is - np
*easier
i havent added anything to the config file, its fresh from installation
ah - ssh_config not ~ssh/.config. My mistake. Can you edit /etc/ssh/ssh_config and see what it at line 55?
Hostkey /etc/ssh/ssh_host_key
does that file exist?
yes
from what i can read it contains my private host key...
you got me here. I can't find anything about that keyword in man
hmmm
got to suggest it, though it might be a bad idea - comment it out and see what you get
brb, have to logg on my other network without internet
it does seem that is a directive for sshd_config, not ssh_config
it worked, thanks for the help
dont know why i didnt think about trying that before asking :S
might be worth just checking a bit more to make sur eI haven't told you to disable something vital. I still think that's a sshd directive thought
i'll do some more research to see if it can damage my system
cool
